content.p: Globalisation has powerful implications for Higher Education and universities have responded in various ways, most notably through enhanced internationalisation. The University of Nottingham is an acknowledged world leader in this field, not only for its commitment to the internationalisation of its UK campus but also through fifteen yearsâ€™ experience with its overseas campuses. This module explores what it means to be an international university. Course start date: Wednesday, 3 February 2016 for six weeks on NOOC, via Moodle. Enrolment: Enrolment has now opened for this module. Enrol now. Runs by: The School of Education UK, with facilitation by Knowledge Without Borders Network. There are no other requirements to join this course as it is open to everyone - students and staff. You can do as much or as little of the course as you wish. Further course information is provided within the course. To academics whose students who enrol for the course are eligible for credits towards the Nottingham Advantage Award module (XX12N6N). You may email KWBN for more details. We look forward to starting to work with you and the rest of the Nottingham community on Wednesday, 3 February 2016. By registering to accredit this module you are agreeing to the Terms and Conditions. telephone: +6 (03) 8924 8000 fax: +6 (03) 8924 8001
